result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathan M Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges by 6/15/16. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

*Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Straight time, no huber, no good time, in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.
Court advised defendant that due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnathan M Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness Simone C processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26210616 in court 1x on 6/15/15.
Witness fee request prepared for Simone C. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Defendant Johnathan M Smith in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Johnathan M Smith in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE DALLET.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS, straight time, no huber, no good time, in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served. 
.
AS TO COUNT 3:    Defendant sentenced to serve 75 DAYS the House of Correction with credit for 75 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges by 6/15/16.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief.  Court advised defendant that due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Johnathan M Smith not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.
State informed the Court the victim would like contact with the defendant.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denied the motion.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Johnathan M Smith not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/15/15 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.
Statements made by Simone C.  Court denied the request to modify the no contact order.

Defendant Johnathan M Smith in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.C.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Johnathan M Smith in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant Johnathan M Smith in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
